Following my seventeen years as a 911 dispatcher, I have made it a priority as a state and federal legislator to help improve the Public Safety Answering Points (PSAP) in order to save the lives of victims and our first responders.     Every year, our 911 dispatchers field 40 million emergency calls at our PSAP‚Äôs.  Those who take the call do far more than simply answer a phone and send for help. Just like police, 911 operators are mobilized during critical incidents like massive fires, civil unrest, or major weather events.  Most importantly, 911 dispatchers are Miranda exempt. This means that being able to capture as much information as possible is crucial in helping convict criminals.    Our legislation will better equip our local 911 centers with tools to modernize their infrastructure with text messages, images, and video.  That is why I am proud to join my colleagues in introducing the Next Generation 911 Act of 2017.
